result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Lee Goode was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael Lee Goode in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Defendant Michael Lee Goode in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT #2, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT #1:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  The Court finds that the State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS (CONCURRENT to case 2012CF3226), with credit for 48 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR AND 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR AND 6 MONTHS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Georgette M., or her residence.
* Obtain GED/HSED.
* Obtain and maintain employment, 
   be in school or job training. 
* No firearms; weapons.
Court ordered defendant to pay all costs, fees, and surcharges, including DV surcharge, to be paid from 25% of prison funds, and if not paid during period of extended supervision,case converts to civil judgment. Defendant advised of right to seek postconviction relief, and appeal. Due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Memorandum of Conditions of Extended Supervision.  
Pretrial Incarceration Credit (not filed by defense counsel).  mld
from the State, received and filed.   mld

Attorney Adam J. Schleis in court, defendant Michael Lee Goode not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 5-21-2015 at 1:30 pm.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.  mld

Defendant Michael Lee Goode in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Defendant Michael Lee Goode in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court took judicial notice of the certified documents attached to the criminal complaint regarding the no contact orders and the domestic violence surcharges against defendant on both cases 2011CM5773 and 2012CF3226.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Eric Kradecki.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion for dismissal of count #2 is heard and denied by the Court.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Discovery, offer letter and discovery demand was turned over to defense counsel from the State.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 5-6-2015 at 1:30 pm.   mld

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Georgette M.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Michael Lee Goode in court with attorney Joan E. Zawikowski.  D
efendant Michael Lee Goode in custody.  
William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. 
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
